definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: luminary—abs. Ge 1:16 +; cstr. [[מְאוֹר]] Pr 15:30 +; pl. [[מְאוֹרׂת]] Ge 1:15; [[מְאׂרׂת]] v:Ge 1:14; v:Ge 1:16; cstr. [[מְאוֹרֵי]] Ez Eze 32:8—light, light-bearer, luminary, lamp, of sun & moon Ge 1:14, Ge 1:15, Ge 1:16, Ge 1:16, Ge 1:16 (P) Ez Eze 32:8; moon Ps 74:16; [[מְנׁרַת הַמָּאוֹר]] the lamp-stand of the luminary or light (where ´[[הַמּ]] is sum of seven sacred lamps on golden lamp-stand) Ex 35:14, Ex 35:14, Ex 35:28, Ex 39:37, Nu 4:9, Nu 4:16, cf. Ex 25:6 Ex 27:20, Ex 35:8, Le 24:2 (all P); [[מְאוֹר־עֵינַיִם יְשַׂמַּח־לֵבָ]] Pr 15:30 the luminary of the eyes (= the eyes as a lamp) gives the light of joy to the heart; [[מְאוֹר פָּנֶיךָ]] Ps 90:8 the luminary of thy face (thy face as a lamp) in the light of which the secrets are exposed.
